title: The 5 best Amazon deals you can get this Wednesday
text:
The 5 best Amazon deals you can get this Wednesday

Don't miss out on the top five Amazon deals this Wednesday. (Photo: Reviewed)

— Our editors review and recommend products to help you buy the stuff you need. If you make a purchase by clicking one of our links, we may earn a small share of the revenue. However, our picks and opinions are independent from USA Today’s newsroom and any business incentives.

The art of hunting for deals has become is a finely crafted skill. Above all else, the motto to stand by is as follows: you can never find a good deal on a bad product. In order to recommend our readers the best of the best, we spend our days putting products to the test in our labs, tracking price histories, researching customer reviews, and scouring the web for sales to report on. For today's roundup, we've compiled five Amazon deals that we're pretty psyched about, including a Cuisinart food processor, a Roku, and more.

1. Save $50: The best food processor we've ever tested

Get this coveted food processor at a super low price. (Photo: Reviewed / Jackson Ruckar)

In terms of renowned kitchen gadgets, the Cuisinart 14-Cup Food Processor ranks near the top of the list. The reasons why it's our favorite food processor are abundant—it's the perfect size, it's easy to clean, it quietly operates, and most importantly, it made quick work of every task we threw at it, from chopping onions to slicing tomatoes, as well as kneading pizza dough. Right now as Amazon's Deal of the Day you can save about $50 on this iconic device and snag it for just $100, which is one of the lowest prices we've ever seen, excluding a lightning deal on Prime Day this year.

Get the Cuisinart 14-Cup Food Processor for $99.99 (Save $50)

2. Lowest price: This simple streaming device so you can kiss cable goodbye

Let's be honest, streaming devices are the future, people. (Photo: Roku)

To cable or not to cable, that is the question? More and more people have been recently opting to cut the hefty cable bills from their lives, and get a streaming device instead like the Roku Express, pictured above. This very reasonably priced device allows you to access all your favorite TV channels and apps like Amazon Video, Netflix, and HBO Now, all at the touch of a button. When our TV expert tested the best streaming devices, he found the 2017 model of the Roku Express to be perfectly adequate if you just need basic features like 1080p HD video, though it processed slower than other, more expensive devices. Right now, you can get the improved 2018 model for just $22, which is an all-time low compared to its usual $30 price tag.

Get the Roku Express Streaming Media Player for $22 (Save $8)

3. $15 off: Our favorite affordable weighted blanket

A gravity blanket will be on everyone's wishlist this year, so why not save on it? (Photo: Reviewed / Camryn Rabideau)

Curious about the weighted blanket craze? This ultra relaxing bedding has been all the rage this year, with people raving about the hug-like feeling these blankets give that creates a gentle, soothing effect as they drift off to sleep. With a near perfect 4.4-star rating out of more than 4,300 reviews, the YnM weighted blanket is the perfect option to test one out without breaking the bank.

Right now if you clip the on-page coupon, you can get $15 off any size and color you choose. While weighted blankets often cost well over $100, the YnM is available as low as $43 with this coupon, a small price to pay for our favorite affordable blanket that may just help relieve your stress and anxiety before bedtime. With your extra savings, consider adding a soft duvet cover to your cart to make the YnM even more luxurious.

Get the YnM Weighted Blanket starting at $43 (Save $15)

4. Under $10: a new Echo Dot and a month of Amazon Music Unlimited for $8.98

The Echo Dot was one of the most popular deals last Black Friday and it's back again for Prime Day! (Photo: Reviewed / Betsey Goldwasser)

Amazon is still running this insane deal on the Echo Dot, as a package deal with one month of Amazon Music Unlimited for $8.98. This is by far the lowest price our favorite affordable Amazon echo speaker has ever been, by like, a planet's distance. If you shop this crazy deal, just remember to cancel Amazon Music Unlimited before the month is up, unless you'd like it to auto-renew for $9.99 a month. But with your new Echo, you can just have Alexa remind you. Pretty convenient, eh?

If you've been wanting a voice assistant for a while now, I'm stating the obvious here, but now's the time to buy. With over 50,000 skills, Alexa can assist you in ways you didn't even know you needed, whether you need help tracking your fitness goals and staying healthy, improving your sleep habits, or just the basics like checking the news, traffic, and weather, setting reminders and alarms, adding things to your shopping list, and gaining voice control for your compatible smart home devices.

Get the Amazon Echo Dot (3rd gen.) with 1 month of Amazon Music Unlimited for $8.98 (Save $41.01)

5. Save $65: The best dutch oven on the market

A Staub looks gorgeous in any home. (Photo: Staub)

Whether you want to braise meats or veggies or simmer hearty stews and soups this season, a Dutch oven can do the job incredibly well, and look great doing it. When we tested the best Dutch ovens, we chose the Staub 5.5-Quart Round Cocotte as our top pick because it was the perfect size to fit on the stove and cooked each recipe our tester made to perfection. Normally retailing for $325, right now you can save $65 and get select colors like cherry and black matte for $260, which is the perfect discount if you want to save on a Staub ahead of the holidays. Just make sure to act quick if you want one, because these are selling out fast!

Get the Staub Round Cocotte Oven, 5.5 Quart at Amazon for $259.95 (Save $65)

The product experts at Reviewed have all your shopping needs covered. Follow Reviewed on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram for the latest deals, reviews, and more.

Prices were accurate at the time this article was published but may change over time.
